headline: Why Walgreens Is Shuttering 1,200 Stores While Pharma Sales Soar To $722 Billion
summary: Walgreens is pulling the plug on 1,200 stores over the next three years. That's no small cut. And they're not the only ones feeling the squeeze. Business Insider reported that CVS and Rite Aid are scaling back too. So, how does a business in the middle of a $722 billion industry end up here? Let's break it down.
